element.title: Rhinoceros
element.description: There are black rhinos and white rhinos in Africa.

element.title: Ostriches
element.description: Ostriches are the biggest birds in the world!

element.title: Zebras
element.description: Zebras are black and white.

element.title: Giraffes
element.description: Giraffes are the tallest animals in the world.

element.title: Leopard
element.description: Leopards can run very fast!

element.title: Lion
element.description: Male lions sleep for 20 hours a day!

element.title: Humpback whale
element.description: Humpback whales are as a big as buses!

element.title: Elephants
element.description: Elephants are the biggest land animals on Earth.

element.title: Red Colobus monkey
element.description: These monkeys live in the trees.

element.title: Hyenas
element.description: Hyenas laugh to talk to each other.

element.title: Gazelle
element.description: Gazelles can jump very high.

element.title: Flamingos
element.description: Flamingos stand on one leg.

element.title: Meerkats
element.description: Meerkats live together in big families.

element.title: Gorilla
element.description: Gorillas are very clever animals.

element.title: Wildebeest
element.description: One million wildebeest cross the Serengeti to find food and water.

element.title: Marguerite Barankitse
element.description: She saved the lives of lots of children.

element.title: Saran Kaba Jones
element.description: She helps bring clean and safe water to Liberia.

element.title: Fatou Bensouda
element.description: She is a famous international lawyer.

element.title: Kofi Annan
element.description: He won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2001.

element.title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf
element.description: She was the first female president in Africa.

element.title: Library designed by Diébédo Kéré
element.description: He was the first child in his village to go to school. Now he designs buildings like this one.

element.title: Mount Kilimanjaro
element.description: This is the highest mountain in Africa.

element.title: Victoria Falls
element.description: This is the biggest waterfall in the world.

element.title: Ngorongoro Crater
element.description: A huge volcano exploded here millions of years ago.

element.title: Darling Wind Farm
element.description: These windmills use the wind to make electricity.

element.title: The Nile
element.description: The Nile is the longest river in the world. It flows through many countries.

element.title: Basilica of Our Lady of Peace
element.description: This is the biggest church in the world.

element.title: Coral reef
element.description: Divers are looking at the animals and plants under the sea.

element.title: Boulders Beach
element.description: Lots of penguins live here.

element.title: Aït Benhaddou
element.description: Lots of people visit this beautiful village.

element.title: Cape Town Stadium
element.description: Lots of famous footballers have played here.

element.title: Nairobi
element.description: Nairobi is the capital city of Kenya.

element.title: Lake Malawi
element.description: Lake Malawi is the third biggest lake in Africa.

element.title: Saladin Citadel of Cairo
element.description: Rulers of Egypt lived here for hundreds of years.

element.title: Baobab trees
element.description: Madagascar is the biggest island in Africa. Lots of animals live there.

element.title: Pyramids
element.description: These pyramids were built thousands of years ago.

element.title: The Sahara Desert
element.description: The Sahara is the biggest desert in the world. It stretches across many countries.

element.title: King Protea
element.description: This is the national flower of South Africa.

element.title: Helicopter
element.description: This helicopter is flying over South Africa.

element.title: Cable car
element.description: People use cable cars to get to the top of mountains.

element.title: SupaBRCK, made by BRCK
element.description: This helps connect users to the internet.

element.title: Djembe
element.description: These drums come from West Africa. They are played all over the world.

element.title: Solar panel
element.description: This solar panel uses the sun to make electricity.

element.title: Great Mosque of Djenné
element.description: This is the largest building in the world that is made of mud.

element.title: Lake Assal
element.description: This lake has beaches made of salt.

element.title: Vivian Cheruiyot
element.description: She has won four Olympic medals for running!

element.title: Butterfly
element.description: This is an African Monarch butterfly.

element.title: Crocodile
element.description: Crocodiles have been on Earth for millions of years.

element.title: African buffalo
element.description: African buffalo have big horns shaped like question marks.

element.title: Tree tumbo
element.description: This plant can live for a thousand years.
